instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC: What is PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC? PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC Is a reference voltage for the SMC’s voltage sensors & other sensors..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only powers on after a long press of power button
threads.message:
Clean board, had some work done near keyboard connector somewhere else, checked all that work and everything is fine.

Problem is that when board is connected to power for first time it tries to turn on but shuts down right away, board will start fine after pressing and holding power button or shorting <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> for a few seconds usually more than 5 seconds, even then not all the time it starts but most of the times it will.

So far I have tried clean ME BIOS, new SMC, new <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and new <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> but same exact thing.

<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> Pin 1-3 3.3v pin 5 3.3v

PPBUS when board is off 12.56v

Diode mode on <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is on par with working board, same with pins 1-3-5 of <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> all measure fine

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only powers on after a long press of power button
threads.message:
Looks like your board only boots in SMC bypass mode.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only powers on after a long press of power button
threads.message: I checked those before and they are fine  17/18 4.3Ω and 27/28 20.9Ω

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only powers on after a long press of power button
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only powers on after a long press of power button
threads.message: They are on par as far as diode mode reading, but when board is off and connected to power <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> is 2.4v and all the others are 0v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only powers on after a long press of power button
threads.message:
Aaaa, board tries to start in normal mode, but shuts down fast.
Then must be another SMC sensor issue; check pages 42-44.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only powers on after a long press of power button
threads.message:
Ok this board end up back in our place again and I will like to fix it this time.

Already checked all sensors in pages 42-43-44 they all look fine and measured correct.

When I plug the board to power I can see the amps go up then they come down and board shuts down.

If I short <SIGNAL>SMC_ON</SIGNAL> for about 5 seconds board boots in what I assume is smc bypass.

Board looks clean and it looks like some work was done on the keyboard connector, pins 1-5 have wires/bridges but I already checked that and all that is working fine, in fact this board was used for a while after the keyboard connector was fixed.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only powers on after a long press of power button
threads.message:
Is <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> steady high?
Just in case, remove <CAPACITOR>C4810</CAPACITOR>.
Does the board start normal removing keyboard flex?
Use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, instead of power button.

Is the battery recognized and charging?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only powers on after a long press of power button
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is steady high at 3.4V
Board alone tries to boot, I can see in the PS, but it shoots down shortly after and only a long press/short on <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> will turn it on

Battery is recognized and charge is fine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only powers on after a long press of power button
threads.message:
There is clearly SMC sensor issue, if only starts in SMC bypass mode.
Is <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only powers on after a long press of power button
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C5125</CAPACITOR> was shorted on that line <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>

You are a mastermind, thanks a lot, if you lived near by I would buy you a beer!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Only powers on after a long press of power button
threads.message:
Glad to hear is solved.

Man, I live faraway of Paradise  ;).
Actually Madrid looks more like a Hell...
